item.title: jennifer add a quote by Peter Carey
item.description: "I have traveled widely. I have seen this country in its infancy. I tell you what it will become. The public squares will be occupied by an uneducated class who will not be able to quote a line of Shakespeare." -- Peter Carey

item.title: jennifer add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "You never have to change anything you got up in the middle of the night to write." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: jennifer add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "It's usually the selfish people who are loved the most. They do what you deny yourself, and you love them for it. You give them your heart." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: jennifer add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Every one suspects himself of at least one of the cardinal virtues, and this is mine: I am one of the few honest people that I have ever known." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: jennifer add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "Curiosity is insubordination in its purest form." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: jennifer add a quote by Stanley Milgram
item.description: "The disappearance of a sense of responsibility is the most far-reaching consequence of submission to authority." -- Stanley Milgram

item.title: jennifer add a quote by Javier Marías
item.description: "What happened between us both happened and didn't happen, it's the same with everything, why do or not do something, why say "yes" or "no," why worry yourself with a "perhaps" or a "maybe," why speak, why remain silent, why refuse, why know anything if nothing of what happens happens, because nothing happens without interruption, nothing lasts or endures or is ceaselessly remembered, what takes place is identical to what doesn't take place, what we dismiss or allow to slip by us is identical to what we accept and seize, what we experience identical to what we never try; we pour all our intelligence and out feelings and our enthusiasm into the task of discriminating between things that will all be made equal, if they haven't already been, and that's why we're so full of regrets and lost opportunities, of confirmations and reaffirmations and opportunities grasped, when the truth is that nothing is affirmed and everything is constantly in the process of being lost. Or perhaps there never was anything." -- Javier Marías

item.title: jennifer add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "I wonder which is preferable, to walk around all your life swollen up with your own secrets until you burst from the pressure of them, or to have them sucked out of you, every paragraph, every sentence, every word of them, so at the end you're depleted of all that was once as precious to you as hoarded gold, as close to you as your skin - everything that was of the deepest importance to you, everything that made you cringe and wish to conceal, everything that belonged to you alone - and must spend the rest of your days like an empty sack flapping in the wind, an empty sack branded with a bright fluorescent label so that everyone will know what sort of secrets used to be inside you?" -- Margaret Atwood
